body.p: All learning is done in menu Learn. "Learning one by one" means learning one single entry in a learning stack at a time.

When starting learning a dialog is presented to allow you to choose the learning direction. E.g. in a vocabulary you do not want to learn always from German to Danish, but also from Danish to German (however the entry type details will alway be of the target.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing the dialog for choosing the direction of learning

body.p: The application shows the entries one by one without showing the solution. A set of different hints can be used, if the solution cannot be remembered. To activate the hints choose a method in the dropdown box at the buttom of the screen and press once or several times the Hint button.
The letters of the solution shuffled (the solution is lyntog):

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing learning hint shuffle

body.p: The first letters of the solution (press several times the Hint button to see more letters):

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing learning hint letter

body.p: Flash shows the solution in a short amount of time, which can be influenced in the preferences screen:

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing preferences for learning hint flash

body.p: Pressing the Show button prints the solution of the current entry . The contents of some fields is shown in query mode and of others only when showing the solution. This is defined in the learning stack properties.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing preferences for learning hint flash
